required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of Baricitinib in Participants From 1 Year to Less Than 18 Years Old With Juvenile Idiopathic Arthritis
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 3 Multicenter Study to Evaluate the Long-Term Safety and Efficacy of Baricitinib in Patients From 1 Year to <18 Years of Age With Juvenile Idiopathic Arthritis (JIA)

brief_summary.textblock: The reason for this study is to see if the study drug baricitinib is safe and effective in the treatment of JIA in participants ages 1 to 17. This study is for participants that have been enrolled in studies I4V-MC-JAHV (NCT03773978) or I4V-MC-JAHU.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants with One or More Serious Adverse Event(s) (SAEs)
primary_outcome.description: Number of participants with one or more SAEs

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants with Permanent Investigational Product Discontinuations
primary_outcome.description: Number of participants with permanent investigational product discontinuations

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of Participants Achieving Pediatric American College of Rheumatology 30 Responder Index (PedACR30)
Proportion of Participants who have Disease Flare
secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of participants who have disease flare

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of Participants with Inactive Disease
secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of participants with inactive disease

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of Participants with Minimal Disease Activity
secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of participants with minimal disease activity

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in Juvenile Arthritis Disease Activity Score-27 (JADAS27)
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline of originating study in JADAS27

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in Arthritis-Related Pain Severity as Measured by the Childhood Health Assessment Questionnaire (CHAQ) Pain Visual Analog Scale (VAS) Item
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in arthritis-related pain severity as measured by the CHAQ pain VAS item

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in Psoriasis Area and Severity Index (PASI)
Change from Baseline in Spondyloarthritis Research Consortium of Canada (SPARCC) Enthesitis Index
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in SPARCC enthesitis index

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in Juvenile Spondyloarthritis Disease Activity Index (JSpADA)
Change from Baseline in Immunoglobulin Levels
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in immunoglobulin levels

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in Immunophenotyping (T Cells)
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in immunophenotyping (T Cells)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Participants must have completed a previous study of baricitinib for the treatment of JIA.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Participants must not have had a permanent discontinuation of baricitinib in the prior study.
- Participants must have not developed an allergy to baricitinib.

link.description: A Study of Baricitinib in Participants From 1 Year to Less Than 18 Years Old With Juvenile Idiopathic Arthritis

clinical_study.keyword: Systemic JIA with and without systemic features

patient_data.ipd_description: Anonymized individual patient level data will be provided in a secure access environment upon approval of a research proposal and a signed data sharing agreement.
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: Data are available 6 months after the primary publication and approval of the indication studied in the US and EU, whichever is later. Data will be indefinitely available for requesting.
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: A research proposal must be approved by an independent review panel and researchers must sign a data sharing agreement.
